Hydras/Talon

=E2=80=9CAhh Prime, it seems that your hot head, isnt too hot=
 after all=E2=80=9Dhissed Hydras with a ironical tone while he flew towards=
 Tucson and added=E2=80=9DYess, I had... an unpleasant visitor and brings t=
his dinasours with him; unlucky, we had to defend ourself. And eventought, =
i dislike work with you, this is one of those ocations that I have to.  Cyc=
lonus, show to our... Visitors the information that you gather. Take in cou=
nt Tuscon and old pal, that as sing of good will; I=E2=80=99ll let you chec=
k the information that we collect from first hand... By they way, nice beas=
t mode, who=E2=80=99s your Tailor?=E2=80=9D

Talon arrived and flew close t=
o Tucson, she was amazed of Tucson=E2=80=99s new beast form

From: Sandy Pa=
nico 
Sent: Monday, August 08, 2011 10:50 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Su=
bject: Re: Strange meetings - the Silver Dragon and the Preds




Tucson pa=
uses and does indeed stop firing and flies a bit of a distance away from Cy=
clonus.  He turns his attentions to the burning Dinosaurs and then back to =
his enemy.  He senses something strange.  The sense that like himself, did =
not anticipate any of the events unfolding.  He turns to face Cyclonus.

" =
Rodimus, you're right.  We can not fight them.  We may have to work WITH th=
em instead.  I don't think they're responsible for the massive death and de=
struction.   Cyclonus!  As much as I hate to admit it, I think we may have =
to work together if we're going to stop whoever is causing the disturbance.=
   It may be our only way to stop it."

Straight Shot arrives with Talon as=
 she now sees events unfolding.

"Wow, he hasn't gone crazy on anyone.  In =
fact, it looks like he's trying to actually talk to them.  That is so defin=
itely a first."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug 8, 2=
011, at 9:19 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:


    
  O=
OC: FYI. I would imagine that Tuscon is about the same size as
  Optimus Pr=
imal, who is approximately 10 feet tall. Since Maximals
  don;t size change=
 all that much, the dragon mode should also be about
  10 feet long, with t=
he tail maybe giving him another 3 - 5 feet or
  length and the wings perha=
ps almost the same width. he would not
  feasibly be able to surround the P=
reds, especailly as far out as they
  are spaced. He can try to circle arou=
nd, but that is a big circle.

  > <OLD>
  >
  > " Look, below us. THAT has=
 no right happening. Hydras has gone too far,
  > and it's time he was put =
in his place!"
  >
  > With a roar of sheer rage, he turns on the surroundi=
ng Predacons releasing a
  > powerful stream of fire, flames a bright hue o=
f red, yellow and blue.
  >
  > " Now let's show Hydras what happens when h=
e preys on innocent creatures!"

  <NEW>

  What stands before TUSCON is ne=
arly ALL the Predacon forces. The
  Fuzors SKYSHADOW, INJECTOR and BUZZCLAW=
 seemed to be keeping watch
  with CYCLONUS flhing lead along with SCOURGE =
and several sweeps.

  DEEPSTRYKE floats high in the air as PHOBIA and BLAC=
K RAZOR circle
  about. as well as WASPINATOR who buzzes about angrilly as =
he watched.

  They are all flying above miles and miles and miles of burni=
ng
  dinosaurs. Beast and reptiles of all sorts! What sorts they were it is=

  difficult to tell, being as they are on fire as the Maximals approach.
 =
 The stench is hideous, and most of the trees and surrounding scrub is
  bu=
rning along with the reptiles, the preds are darting all around the
  super=
 large burning pyre.

  That is until TUSCON starts firing.

  > <OLD Strai=
ght Shot & Talon>
  >
  > As Straight Shot rides with Talon, she picks up o=
n Tucson's location and
  > from a far, realizes what is now transpiring be=
tween him and Hydras! Still
  > in cross bow mode, she calibrates her syste=
ms and weight distribution to fit
  > Talon's configurations, for optimal r=
esults.
  >
  > " Hydras! Ohhh I can't believe he's gonna face off with him=
 again! He
  > doesn't realize that he needs help! Wait, Ohh good, he's not=
 alone, Rodimus
  > is with him. But still, it doesn't hurt ta lend him a h=
and. I better let
  > Leo Prime in on this, he's probably wondering why Tuc=
son isn't contacting
  > him, which is something he's notorious for doing. =
"
  >
  > She opens her link to Leo Prime.
  >
  > " Leo Prime, it's me, St=
raight Shot. Talon and I are reaching Tucson's
  > location shortly and I'm=
 sure he hasn't contacted you yet. He's with
  > Rodimus and now he's facin=
g off with Hydras. A lotta fire just got deployed
  > and I'm definitely su=
re it wasn't from Hydras. Tucson's in a really bad
  > mood, and I think it=
's about ta get worse."

  <NEW>

  "This is Leo. Judging from your locatio=
n we are at least several hours
  from you, and that that is for those of u=
s who can fly. You had better
  get Tuscon reigned in until we can get ther=
e. Leo Prime. Out."

  > <OLD - Straight Shot, Talon & Hydras>
  >
  > Much=
 to Straight Shot's suspicion, Tucson does indeed have the look of an
  > e=
nraged predator on his draconic face. What he wouldn't do to be able to
  >=
 sink his sharp claws into Hydras, tearing at his armor until there was
  >=
 nothing left. Yet he holds enough restraint to hold back from doing so, fo=
r
  > the time being.
  >
  > " Many innocent creatures who were native to =
this planet have lost their
  > lives needlessly, no thanks to you and your=
 reign of greed and destruction.
  > This is NOT our planet and we have NO =
right taking away what belongs here!
  > That is what brings me here, Hydra=
s! This planet deserves freedom and I am
  > here to make sure it gets it!"=

  >
  > He exclaims with a loud draconic roar, as smoke seeps out of his f=
laring
  > nostrils as do a couple of white hot flames.
  >
  > With Rodimu=
s still on his back, Tucson circles Hydras as the never ending
  > coils of=
 his long tail creates a ring around the enemy.
  >
  > "Rodimus, this is a=
lso your chance to take back something that was taken
  > from you. No hold=
s barred, do what you feel is the right thing, and what
  > you feel in you=
r spark is rightful to your cause. I will follow suit. We
  > will fight as=
 one, and as one we will serve judgement to those who deserve
  > it. "
  >=

  > He remains in his circling pattern, waiting for Rodimus to direct him,=
 in
  > hopes to help build his confidence as an Autobot Commander. At the =
same
  > time, Tucson had to learn to control his greatest weakness, his
  =
> uncontrollable temper which left unchecked, had the potential to turn him=

  > into an extremely dangerous individual. Now that he takes on the role =
of a
  > powerful creature, it would prove hard to quell the fire that burn=
s deep
  > within his spark. He hoped that this partnership would help keep=
 the
  > balance between the both of them. They would need that more than e=
ver if
  > they have hopes of stopping Hydras for good.
  >

  <NEW>

  "Tu=
scon!" RODIMUS imperiously said from TUSCON's back. "That's alot of
  Preda=
cons out there. Unless you have some back up out here that I
  don't know a=
bout we are a long way from home." RODIMUS looked around,
  "I see Cyclonus=
, have you seen Hydras yet?"

  It was not fear that moved RODIMUS in all t=
his, but a warrior's
  caution. Even the most fearless of warriors had to k=
now when the odds
  were stacked against them, and when they had even a sno=
wball's chance
  of winning a fight. As RODIMUS pulled out his rifle and ta=
rgeted the
  Predacons, he could not help wondering if he fires will it get=
 them
  all killed, and if TUSCON wanted to them to go down in some blaze o=
f
  glory. Even two primes cannot stand up to the entire Predacon forces!

=
  CYCLONUS and HYDRAS were by themsevles their equals and at the moment
  H=
YDRAS was not visible, which made the situation even more dangerous.
  And =
that was not counting all the other Predacons just waiting to blow
  them o=
ut of the air.

  "What are you doing here." CYCLONUS' voice came over the =
comlink over
  a general frequency. "We have no quarel with you this night.=
 Continue
  firing on us and we will wipe you from the skies."

  There was=
 a wicked chuckle from SKYSHADOW, "I don't think these two
  would try to t=
ake on the entire Predacon army. Maybe they came to be
  the dino beasts al=
ong with us?"

  "He is full of enough hot air." SCOURGE said, sounding alm=
ost eager to
  fight. "Maybe he can put it to some good use." SCOURGE's swe=
eps began
  to circle outwards their weapons charging but not yet firing.

=
  "Finish burning the dinosaurs." CYCLONUS barked to the other Predacons
  =
who seemed to be approaching. "Make sure none of the crazed beasts
  rises =
again."

  CYCLONUS, SCOURGE and the sweeps slid foward, "We will deal with=
 these
  intruders." DEEPSTRYKE PHOBIA and BLACK RAZOR slid in behind them.=


  DEEPSTRYKE sent HYDRAS a message alerting him to TUSCON's and RODIMUS'
=
  appearance and the approach of a flying Maximal. (Talon)

  (TAG)

  Pres=
ton
